api

Interface IComponent

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ISerializable, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IActiveComponent
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Attack, Collision, Defense, Health, ImagePath, Mass, Orientation, Position, Score, Speed, Velocity, Visible

    public interface IComponent
extends ISerializable
    This is the interface for all components, which hold data.
    Author:
    Rhondu Smithwick, Tom Wu

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default java.lang.Class<? extends IComponent> getClassForComponentMap()
      Return the class to put into an entity map.
      default java.util.List<javafx.beans.property.SimpleObjectProperty<?>> getProperties()

      Gets a specific property with specified value class and with specified name.
      default java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Class<?>> getPropertyNamesAndClasses()
      Get a map, where each entry is a component name to it's value class.
      default boolean unique()
      Deprecated.

      • unique

        @Deprecated
default boolean unique()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns if only one of this component is allowed.

      • getProperties

        default java.util.List<javafx.beans.property.SimpleObjectProperty<?>> getProperties()

        Returns:

      • getProperty

        default <T> javafx.beans.property.SimpleObjectProperty<T> getProperty(java.lang.Class<T> propertyClass,
                                                                      java.lang.String name)
                                                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets a specific property with specified value class and with specified name.

        Example call for a position: SimpleObjectProperty$Double$ x = position.getProperty(Double, "X");

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the property's held value
        Parameters:
        propertyClass - the class of the property's held value
        name - the name of property
        Returns:
        specific property of specified class and with name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if incorrect propertyClass or no property with this name is present
